definition: to appear on the public roll of successful examinees (i.e. pass an exam)/to make the list/(of a song) to hit the charts
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees

sentences.english: So congrats to KKR for making the list.
The other 49 listed companies have an average age of 90 years in business.
sentences.chinese: 其餘49家上榜公司平均營商年齡超過90歲。

sentences.english: An emoticon made the list for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 表情符號今年第一次上榜。

sentences.english: Those listed inside the paper we label fat-cats.
sentences.chinese: 上榜的富人被我們稱爲“肥貓”。

sentences.english: Her 20-year-old sister is the second youngest on the list.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山大20歲的姐姐是歲數第二小的上榜富豪。

sentences.english: The latest list includes citizens of 52 countries and one principality.
sentences.chinese: 今年上榜的富豪來自52個國家和1個公國。

sentences.english: Firms that qualify for the index tend to be under the government's cosh.
sentences.chinese: 指數上榜的公司行業大多在政府制定政策中處於劣勢。

sentences.english: On average the companies on our list have a 13% debt-to-equity ratio.
sentences.chinese: 今年上榜企業的債務股本比率平均爲13%。

sentences.english: This is a list of ten of the most infamous criminal duos.
sentences.chinese: 下面上榜的是其中最著名的10對。

sentences.english: The Chinese workers ranked second were the only group named.
sentences.chinese: 中國農民工位居亞軍，是唯一上榜的羣體。

sentences.english: Therefore, we will invite the listed rich to talk about the two topics.
sentences.chinese: 因此我們還將邀請上榜富豪們共話這兩個話題。

sentences.english: Many people would probably be surprised to see Clash of the Titans in the top 10.
sentences.chinese: 許多人看到《諸神之戰》上榜前十可能會驚訝。

sentences.english: Shanghai features twice in the list just released by Plush: “China's top 10 most expensive items in 2009.”
sentences.chinese: 上海也因此兩次上榜“09中國最貴十件事”。

definition: notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
(of a list, music chart etc) to reach the top
to get past the qualifying round/to make it to the finals
to be chosen/to be elected as
to select on the basis of a vote or consensus
to rank (number 1, or third last etc)/to be among (those who are in a particular group)
